isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - ROCKWELL TANDEM AXLE FORWARD REAR DRIVE UNITS - Driver Controlled Main Differential Lock - Installing the Carrier into the Axle Housing

svcproc.title: Installing the Carrier into the Axle Housing

warning.para: Be careful when using cleaning solvent. Follow the solvent manufacturer's instructions for safe use to prevent serious personal injury.

item.para: Clean the inside of the axle housing and the mounting surface where the carrier fastens. Use a cleaning solvent and rags to remove the dirt. Blow dry the cleaned areas with compressed air.
Inspect the axle housing for damage. If necessary, repair or replace the housing.

Check for loose studs in the mounting surface of the housing where the carrier fastens. Remove and replace the studs where required. Apply liquid adhesive to the holes. Install and tighten the stud to 150 to 230 ft-lbs. (204 to 312 Nm).
Install the differential carrier into the housing using the Air Pressure or Manual Engaging Method below.

step1.para: Before the carrier is installed into the housing, install the left-hand axle shaft through the shift collar and into the side gear. (The axle shaft is being used as a spline alignment tool.)

note.para: A similar tool can be made from a damaged left-hand axle shaft by cutting off approximately 24 inches from the spline end.

step1.para: Align the splines of the shift collar and differential case half by rotating the axle shaft tool or drive pinion.

warning.para: Do not use your hands to hold the collar in position. Serious personal injury can result when air pressure is applied to the actuator.

step1.para: Connect an auxiliary air supply to the actuator assembly.
Apply and hold pressure to the actuator assembly. The air pressure will move the shift collar to engage the differential case half and lock the assembly.
If the shift collar has not moved the full distance on the splines of the differential case half, rotate the axle shaft tool to complete the shift.
Remove the axle shaft tool from the carrier.

note.para: Continue to hold the main differential in the locked (engaged) position with air pressure until the carrier is completely installed in the axle housing. If no air supply is available, use the "Manual Engaging Method" on this page to lock (engage) the differential.

step1.para: Apply silicone gasket material to the mounting surface of the housing where the carrier fastens. Recommended silicone materials are Dow Corning Silicone Rubber Sealant, No. 732 Black or General Electric No. RTV-1473 Black.
Install the carrier into the axle housing. Follow steps 6 to 18 under DIFFERENTIAL CARRIER IN THE AXLE HOUSING .
Release the air pressure from the differential lock actuator and disconnect the auxiliary air supply.
Proceed to Step 7 under Manual Engaging Method below.

svcsubproc.title: Manual Engaging Method:
svcsubproc.para: If the differential is in the locked (engaged) position, held by the manual engaging bolt, start with Step 4.

step1.para: Align the splines of the shift collar and the differential case half. This can be done by hand or by installing the left-hand axle shaft through the shift collar and into the side gear. See Step 1 and 2 of the " Air Pressure Method."
Install the manual engaging bolt into the threaded hole in the center of the cylinder cover.

Turn the manual engaging bolt to the right until the head of the bolt is approximately 1/4 inch from the cylinder cover. DO NOT turn the bolt beyond its normal stop. The bolt is now in the service position and the main differential lock is completely engaged.

caution.para: There will be a small amount of spring resistance felt when you turn in the manual engaging bolt. If a high resistance is felt before reaching the locked (engaged) position, STOP TURNING THE BOLT or the cover, the fork and bolt threads will be damaged.

para.emph: A high resistance on the bolt indicates that the splines of the shift collar and the differential case half are not aligned or engaged.

Lift the shift collar as required and rotate to align the splines of collar and case half while you turn in the manual engaging bolt. When the normal amount of spring resistance is again felt on the bolt, the splines are engaged. Continue to turn in the manual engaging bolt.

step1.para: Install and fasten the carrier into the axle housing. Follow Steps 7 and 8 of the "Air Pressure Method" above.
Remove the plug and gasket from the storage position. Remove the manual engaging bolt from its service position.

note.para: When the manual engaging bolt is removed from the service position in the actuator, the main differential lock becomes disengaged.

step1.para: Clean the plug, gasket, cylinder or cylinder cover, and threaded hole in the center of the cylinder cover or cylinder.
Install the plug and gasket into their operating position in the cylinder cover or cylinder. Install the manual engaging bolt into its storage position ( Figure 196 and Figure 197).

step1.para: Tighten the plug to 44 to 55 ft-lbs (60 to 75 Nm) torque. Tighten the manual engaging bolt to 15 to 25 ft-lbs (20 to 35 Nm).
Connect the vehicle air line to the differential lock actuator assembly.
Install the electrical connection on the sensor switch.
Install the right and left-hand axle shafts.
Remove the jack stand from under the drive axle and lower the vehicle to the floor.
Fill the axle to the fill hole level with a lube recommended in GROUP 10 - LUBRICATION in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
